japanese: なんでこんなにモノが詰め込んであるの？
english: Why are so many things crammed in?

english: Why do you have so many towels?

english: Why are there twenty nail clippers in this house? Maybe they use a different nail clipper for each finger and toe? Is that the custom in this house?

japanese: 私には弟と姉がいます。
english: I have a little brother and a big sister.

english: I have an elder sister 3 years above me and a younger brother 2 years below me.

japanese: 今、弟は小６で姉は高３です。
english: Now, my younger brother is in 6th grade elementary and my older sister is in 3rd grade highschool.

japanese: １０月まで食料は持つだろう。
english: Our food supply will last till October.

japanese: トムは建築士で、あの建物の設計をした。
english: Tom was the architect that designed that building.

japanese: １日で、平均してどれぐらいの量の宅配ピザを作っているのでしょうか？
english: On average, how many delivery pizzas are made in one day?

english: This tastes like salmon.

japanese: トムの専攻は哲学だ。
english: Tom's major is philosophy.

english: My daughter graduated from high school last year.

japanese: トムの血液型はＡ型です。

japanese: あなたがいなかったら、できなかったと思う。
english: I don't think I could've done it without you.

japanese: 手伝ってくれなかったら、できなかったと思う。
english: I don't think I could've done it without you.

japanese: 早く食べないと。
english: I have to eat first.

japanese: この鳥は今、絶滅の危機に瀕しています。
english: This bird is now in danger of extinction.

japanese: 本の８ページを開いてください。
english: Open your books to page 8, please.

english: We crossed the road.

english: The balcony is small.

japanese: トムはたぶん友達の家に行ったんだよ。

japanese: もっと家族と一緒に過ごしたいんだ。
english: I'd like to spend some more time with my family.

english: I think the batteries need to be replaced.

english: I've never seen this species of fish before.

english: We have the same name.

english: Our names are the same.

english: Five squared is twenty-five.

japanese: この時計は正確に時を刻みます。

japanese: この時計は正確な時を刻みます。
english: This watch keeps accurate time.

japanese: この実は食べれるんだよ。

english: His speech was very short.

english: His speech was very short.

english: My dad is a fishing maniac.

english: This is a souvenir from Australia.

english: The scissors aren't sharp.

japanese: このハサミ、切れ味悪いな。

japanese: 鞄が重くて一人では運べなかったの。

japanese: Aを取るために一生懸命頑張ってたもんだよ。

japanese: A判定をもらうために、必死に頑張ってたもんさ。
english: I used to try really hard to get straight A's.

japanese: ボストンからそれほど遠くない小さな町を訪ねました。
english: I visited a small town not too far from Boston.

japanese: ボストンからさほど遠くないこぢんまりとした町を訪ねた。

japanese: 今日中に答えを出してほしい。

english: When I was still a newcomer, I did only odd jobs and wasn't given any serious work.

japanese: なけなしのお金を彼女にあげたの。

english: Spitting on streets is a crime in Singapore.

english: I saw Tom yesterday evening.

english: City and country life are very different.

english: There are no lessons in August.

japanese: 「猫ちゃんはどこ？」「ソファーの下だよ」
english: "Where's the cat?" "It's under the sofa."

japanese: 買いたい物を全部買おうにも、お金が足りないな。
english: I don't have enough money to buy everything I want to buy.

japanese: 「遅かったわね」「あぁ。『いい仕事するなぁ』って言われてさぁ。断れなくなって、ついついこんな時間までやっちゃった」「ほんと、褒め言葉に弱いんだから」
english: "You're late." "Yeah. I was told I've been doing such a good job, so I couldn't say no, and I ended up working late." "You really are a sucker for flattery."

japanese: 褒められて伸びるタイプなんです。
english: I can say with certainty that I am the type of person that improves with compliments.

english: I think this and that are separate things.

japanese: 彼はペンシルベニアで働いてるんだ。

japanese: トムって、本当は優しい人なんだよ。

japanese: 僕らは長年トムを待っている。

english: Tom isn't from Australia. He's from New Zealand.

english: If I had money, I'd give it to you.

japanese: 今の時代、何でもありだからね。

japanese: 「それ何？」「本だよ」
english: "What's that?" "It's a book."

japanese: もうこの村にはいないよ。
english: They don't live in this village any more.

japanese: 人は嘘つきだ。

japanese: 人は嘘をつくものさ。

japanese: バタフライノットは、上手にできる？
english: Are you good at tying butterfly knots?

japanese: 香水、めっちゃきついね。

japanese: 天気が崩れそうだね。

japanese: 天気が回復しそうね。
english: It seems the weather will improve.

japanese: バルコニーにベンチがあります。

japanese: ベランダに長椅子が置いてあります。
english: There's a bench on the balcony.

japanese: 桃色って、かわいい色ね。
english: Pink is a pretty color.

japanese: ピンクって、可愛い色だね。

english: "When you join together the sleeves on a kimono, does the right side or the left side go on top?" "The left goes on top. So that when others see it it looks like a y." Thanks."

english: The date on the document was October 20, 2013.

japanese: 「メアリーは、なんでトムを作ったの？」「かわいいショタの彼氏が欲しかったんだ」「へー、メアリーってショタコンだったんだ？知らなかったよ」「まだまだね」
english: "Why did Mary will Tom into existence?" "She wanted a cute shota boyfriend." "I didn't know she was into that." "There's a lot you don't know about her."

english: "I couldn't sleep last night because that cat wouldn't shut up with its meowing." "Same. I woke up, too." "And apparently my neighbor couldn't take it anymore either. When he yelled at the cat to shut up, it ran away, but I was so startled I couldn't go back to sleep."

english: "Oh no, there's not enough time. This is hopeless, I'm just gonna wing it and try my best tomorrow, I don't care anymore." "What's the problem?" "I have an in-class presentation tomorrow, and I have all the materials ready, but I haven't gone over them yet. I've really messed up this time." "Well, no help for it."

japanese: 「あ、田中さん！」「あっ......！」「元気だった？」「うん。えっと、あっ......！名前ど忘れしちゃった。ごめんなさい。名前なんて言うんだったけ？」「もぉ、国貞よ。国貞恵子」「そうそう、国貞さん。お久しぶり！」
english: "Oh, Tanaka-san!" "Uh...!" "Have you been doing well?" "Yeah. Um, uh...! Oh my god, I'm so sorry, but your name is slipping my mind. What's your name again?" "Really? Come on. I'm Kunisada. Keiko Kunisada." "Oh, right, Kunisada-san. It's been a while!"

english: "Hey, did you finish putting together that list I asked for before?" "Oh, I had completely forgotten." "Listen. I really need that list, and you're telling me you just 'completely forgot' it? What?" "I'm very sorry."

english: If you draw a line directly, Tom's house within 100 meters just across the river. But when you actually try and go, it's about a 1 kilometre distance to the bridge, so it takes 20 minutes by foot to get there.

japanese: 人生楽しんだもん勝ちよ。

japanese: トムさぁ、僕みて話すのやめたんだよ。
english: Tom stopped talking when he saw me.

japanese: 私はやっと御兄弟を説得して私の案を受け入れさせた。
english: I finally managed to persuade her siblings to accept my plan.

japanese: 御兄弟を説得して、私の案をやっと受け入れてもらった。
english: I finally managed to persuade her siblings to accept my plan.

japanese: 昨夜の写真よ。
english: These are the photos from last night.

japanese: インフルエンザになっちゃった。
english: I've got the flu.

japanese: ここに置いてもいいよ。
english: You can put it here.

japanese: 「ハハ！」とスペイン語で言った。
english: "Ha, ha!" he said in Spanish.

japanese: 今日は、中秋節です。
english: Today is the Mid-Autumn Festival.

japanese: 実は、兄とは異母兄弟なんですよ。
english: Actually, my brother is my half-brother.

japanese: 庭で遊ぶのが好きなんだ。
english: I like playing in the yard.

japanese: 昨夜ここで何があったの？
english: What happened here last night?

japanese: ブラジルが私の故郷です。
english: Brazil is my home.

japanese: ブラジルは僕の故郷です。
english: Brazil is my home.

japanese: なんでこの肝心な時にトムがいないんだよ！
english: Why isn't Tom here at this crucial moment?

japanese: 道路で、泣きながら座っている少女を見かけた。
english: I saw a little girl sitting by the road, crying.

japanese: あの雲、私の犬に似てる。
english: That cloud looks like my dog.

japanese: 一番好きなスポーツはバスケです。
english: My favorite sport is basketball.

japanese: ここね、私が住んでた家なのよ。
english: This is the house that I used to live in.

japanese: あなたの事は大好きなんだけどね、結婚はちょっと......。
english: I like you a lot, but I don't want to marry you.

japanese: ２人は抱き合い、別れを惜しんだ。
english: The 2 people embraced, and then bid farewell reluctantly.

japanese: このトマトスープ美味しい。
english: The tomato soup tastes good.

japanese: トマトスープ、いい味してる。
english: The tomato soup tastes good.

japanese: 彼女は最近出産しました。
english: She recently gave birth.

japanese: 彼女は最近赤ちゃんを産んだ。
english: She recently gave birth.

japanese: ベジタリアンのレストランなの？
english: Is it a vegetarian restaurant?

japanese: 猫ってネズミを食べちゃうんだけど、うちの猫のピーターソン君はネズミと仲良しなんですよ。
english: Cats eat mice, but our cat Mr Peterson is friends with one.

japanese: メアリーのこと、トムに何て言うの？
english: What are you going to tell Tom about Mary?

japanese: その言葉を使うのはおやめなさい。
english: Please stop using that term.

japanese: トム、ここに座りたかったら、座っていいよ。
english: Tom, you can sit here if you want to.

japanese: 座りたいんなら、ここに座っていいよ。
english: If you want to sit, you may sit here.

japanese: あなたの車、洗ってあげるよ。
english: I'll wash your car for you.

japanese: トムはよく哀しい歌を口ずさんでるよ。
english: Tom is frequently humming sad songs.

japanese: この通りには駐車場がない。
english: There's no parking on this street.

japanese: 貯金箱って、普通ブタの形してるのに、僕のはカンガルーのような形なんだよな。どうしてなのか、未だに謎なんだ。
english: Piggy banks are usually shaped like pigs, but mine's shaped like a kangaroo. I still don't know why.

japanese: 探してる言葉に合う言葉がない時に、自分で考え出すのが好きなんだ。
english: I like making up my own words when the word I'm looking for doesn't exist.

japanese: ダメなんじゃない？
english: Isn't that bad?

japanese: ちょっと待ちや！
english: Hold on a moment!

japanese: トムはガキンチョよ。
english: Tom is a brat.

japanese: 雪深いところは歩きにくいって分かったよ。
english: I found it difficult to walk in the deep snow.

japanese: 雪深いところは歩きづらいって分かったよ。
english: I found it difficult to walk in the deep snow.

japanese: これは水じゃありませんよ。灯油ですよ。
english: This isn't water. It's kerosene.

japanese: 今日の試合は、ボロ勝ちだったよ。
english: Today's match was a total victory.

japanese: 今日の試合は、ボロ負けでした。
english: Today's match was a total defeat.

japanese: ボストンに行く予定はないよ。
english: I'm not planning to visit Boston.

japanese: エビはあまり好きじゃないんだ。
english: I don't like shrimps much.

japanese: ７時以降なら、時間があるわよ。
english: I'll have time after seven o'clock.

japanese: 町までは遠いよ。
english: It's a long way to town.

japanese: それは彼がミスったんだ！
english: That was his mistake!

japanese: 魚釣りはな、わしの趣味のひとつなんだ。
english: Fishing is one of my hobbies.

japanese: どうしてバスを借りたいの？
english: Why do you want to rent a bus?

japanese: 彼は宗教に関する本を持っています。
english: He has a book about religion.

japanese: 最初にこれをして。
english: Do this first.

japanese: ８時に電話して。
english: Call me at eight.

japanese: もう昼食はいただきました。
english: We've already had lunch.

japanese: 僕、床で寝れるよ。
english: I can sleep on the floor.

japanese: 軽く食べに行かない？
english: Why don't we go grab a bite to eat?

japanese: 一昨日は月曜日だったよ。
english: The day before yesterday was Monday.

japanese: トムはこんなのやらないよ。
english: Tom isn't going to do this.

japanese: トムは体を動かすのが苦手だ。
english: Tom isn't able to move.

japanese: トムは自分がお金持ちであることを、メアリーに知られたくないと思っている。
english: Tom doesn't want Mary to know that he's rich.

japanese: リスは木の実を埋めちゃうんだ。
english: Squirrels bury nuts.

japanese: リスは木を植えるのを手伝ってくれます。
english: Squirrels help plant trees.

japanese: リスたちは、植樹のお手伝いをしてくれます。
english: Squirrels help plant trees.

japanese: どうしてみんな、そんなふくれっ面してんの？
english: Why do you all have such sour faces?

japanese: なんでみんな、そんな不機嫌そうな顔してんの？
english: Why do you all have such sour faces?

japanese: そうしたいのは山々だけど、色々なしがらみがあるのも確かです。
english: As much as I'd love to, there are certainly many things still holding me back.

japanese: ギターは弾くけど、歌わないよ。
english: I play the guitar, but I don't sing.

japanese: ギターは弾きますが、歌は歌いません。
english: I play the guitar, but I don't sing.

japanese: 語順の変更を提案します。
english: I suggest changing the word order.

japanese: 今すぐやめて。
english: You need to stop this now.

japanese: トムとメアリーって、恐らくみんなが思ってるほど歳はいってないよ。
english: Tom and Mary probably aren't as old as everybody thinks.

japanese: 「これって、あってる？」「はい、ご名答！」
english: "Is this correct?", "Yes, that is the correct answer!"

japanese: これは、種なしぶどうよ。
english: These are seedless grapes.

japanese: 私の叔父は灯台で働いてます。
english: My uncle works in a lighthouse.

japanese: 光沢紙がいいな。
english: I like glossy paper.

japanese: 光沢のある紙が好き。
english: I like glossy paper.

japanese: 寒かったから、セーターを着たんだよ。
english: I was cold, so I put on a sweater.

japanese: あら？不在票が入ってるわ。
english: Oh, I got a delivery notice.

japanese: トムが来る可能性だってある。
english: There's even a chance that Tom will be there.

japanese: 彼女を殺そうとしてるんだ。
english: They're trying to kill her.

japanese: あの子を殺害しようとしてるのよ。
english: They're trying to kill her.

japanese: あなたは私を後方へ押し始めた。
english: You started pushing me backwards.

japanese: ここ触ると痛い？
english: Does it hurt if I touch here?

japanese: 「今、何時？」「12時ちょっと過ぎ」
english: "What's the time?" "A little past noon."

japanese: 長距離も、へっちゃらよ。
english: Long distance is also easy.

japanese: 日本では今、朝よ。
english: It's morning in Japan now.

japanese: 「お久しぶりって感じね。元気にしてる？」「してる。してる。最近、忙しくてさ、なかなか時間がとれないのよ。今ね、病院の待合室。時間が少しできたからメッセージ書いてみたの」
english: "Feels like I haven't seen you in forever. You doing good?" "Yeah, I'm good. I've been so busy lately I haven't had much time to spare. Right now I'm at a hospital in the waiting room, and I had a bit of time so I thought I'd shoot you a message."

japanese: 好きなユーザーさんの文をよく訳します。
english: I often translate sentences by users I like.

japanese: お気に入りのユーザーさんの文を訳すことが多いです。
english: I often translate sentences by users I like.

japanese: ストローに穴は幾つあるでしょう？
english: How many holes are there in a straw?

japanese: テーブルの上に置いてください。
english: Please put it on the table.

japanese: 机の上に置いてください。
english: Please put it on the table.

japanese: 地図をトムに手渡しました。
english: I handed Tom the map.

japanese: 地図はトムに渡したよ。
english: I handed Tom the map.

japanese: 今は３時限目の授業です。
english: I'm in my third period class.

japanese: ３時間目の授業中です。
english: I'm in my third period class.

japanese: これは宿題やるより楽しいよ。
english: This is more fun than doing homework.

japanese: 彼らに分からせたの？
english: Did you make them understand?

japanese: 私はブラジル人ですが、祖父がパリで生まれ、私の苗字がフランス系なのと、私自身フランスが大好きなので、フランス代表チームを応援しています。
english: Even though I'm Brazilian, I root for the French national team because my grandpa was born in Paris and I have a French last name, and also because I love France.

japanese: トムは教室にいた全員を殺害した。
english: Tom killed everyone in the classroom.

japanese: やめろよ。いい加減にしろ。
english: Stop. That's enough.

japanese: ぜひ、翻訳として追加してください。
english: Please be sure to add that as a translation.

japanese: この梨は、最後に食べよっと。
english: I will eat this pear as last.

japanese: これ、いい値段するわね。
english: I want a better price on this.

japanese: これ、良心的なお値段ね。
english: This has a fair price.

japanese: 久しぶりに見たなー、こーゆーの。
english: I haven't seen one of these in forever.

japanese: みんな、帰れ！
english: Everybody, go home!

japanese: 膝痛めたから、今日練習に行かないよ。
english: I hurt my knee today, so I'm not going to practice today.

japanese: トムはたいてい月曜日は家にいるよ。
english: Tom usually stays home on Monday.

japanese: 地図はトムにあげたよ。
english: I gave Tom the map.

japanese: トムは、ジャンクフードは食べないようにしてるのよ。
english: Tom tries to not eat junk food.

japanese: トムはジャンクフードは控えてるのよ。
english: Tom tries to not eat junk food.

japanese: 分かった、君の方法で試してみるよ。
english: All right, we'll try it your way.

japanese: トムにもう一度やらせてあげて。
english: Let Tom try again.

japanese: 泣かしてくれてやる。
english: I'm gonna make you cry!

japanese: 泣かしてやる！
english: I'm gonna make you cry!

japanese: テメー、目障りなんだよ。
english: Oi you! Get out of my sight!

japanese: ただで済むと思ってんのか。
english: You'd better not be thinking it's just gonna finish like this?!

japanese: 黙ってられっか！
english: Expect me just to keep my mouth shut, do you?!

japanese: そう甘かぁねーんだよ。
english: I ain't that soft, y'know!

japanese: 手ェ出すたぁ、いい度胸だ。
english: It takes real guts to start a fight.

japanese: なんでオレェブロックしてんかよっ？
english: Why are you blocking me?

japanese: 殺されてーのか。
english: Do you wanna get yourself killed?!?

japanese: なんつームチャすんだ、テメエは。
english: You're acting pretty damn rash here, you little punk!

japanese: 離せっつってんだろ！
english: I told you to let me go!

japanese: 放してって言ったの！
english: I told you to let me go!

japanese: 帰れっつってんだよ！
english: I told you, go home!

japanese: 帰れって、言ったの！
english: I told you, go home!

japanese: 待てっつったろ！
english: I told you to wait!

japanese: 待ってって言ったでしょ！
english: I told you to wait!

japanese: いらねえっつったろ！
english: I told you I don't need it!

japanese: いらないって言ったでしょ。
english: I told you I don't need it!

japanese: 「今日ね、久しぶりに海藻を食べてみたんだけど、美味しかった」「日本ではよく食卓にあがるんだけど、アメリカではあまりあがらないの？」「普通の家ではよく出てるみたいだよ。でも、僕んちではあまり出てこないよ」
english: "I tried some seaweed today after not eating any for a while, and it was delicious." "In Japan, it's often part of a meal. Is that less common in the U.S.?" "I think it's common in most families, but not really in mine."

japanese: 私、四つ葉を見つけるの得意なんだよ。
english: I'm really good at finding four-leaf clovers.

japanese: ありがとう。これって、すごく役に立ちそう。
english: Thanks. This is going to help me a lot.

japanese: 私、四つ葉のクローバー見つけるの上手なんだよ。
english: I'm really good at finding four-leaf clovers.

japanese: トムの役立たず！
english: Tom's useless!

japanese: これあげる。余ったから。
english: I'm giving you this. It was left over.

japanese: 失恋も何もアンタ一つもがんばってないでしょ。
english: You haven't ever had to suffer a broken heart, or anything else, for that matter.

japanese: 助けるつもりか？やめておけ。お前の為にもそいつの為にもな。
english: Are you thinking of going to save him? Forget about that, for both your sakes.

japanese: ドイツのケーキ「バームクーヘン」は、日本で人気の高いデザートです。
english: The German cake Baumkuchen is a popular dessert in Japan.

japanese: 日本では、ドイツのケーキ「バームクーヘン」は人気のあるデザートなんだよ。
english: The German cake Baumkuchen is a popular dessert in Japan.

japanese: 今夜の月は幻想的だね。
english: This evening's moon is fantastic.

japanese: 彼女のスカート姿って、見たことないわね。
english: I have never seen what she looks like wearing a skirt.

japanese: 彼女って、いつもスカートでパンツ姿なんて見たことないよ。
english: She's always wearing skirts and I've never seen her wearing trousers.

japanese: トムは私なんか眼中にないのよ。
english: Tom will never look at someone like me.

japanese: 私のスクールバッグって、すごく重いのよ。
english: My schoolbag is very heavy.

japanese: この映画は何回も観たわ。
english: I have watched this film several times.

japanese: レンガ職人が壁を施工している。
english: The bricklayer is building a wall.

japanese: この本には蔵書印が押してあります。
english: This book has a library stamp.

japanese: セーフティボックスの暗証番号を忘れてしまった。
english: I forgot the code for the safe deposit box.

japanese: 僕たちのグループは５人グループです。
english: Our group has 5 people.

japanese: したいしたいって言われても、させるわけにはいかない。
english: No matter how much you want to do that, I can't let you.

japanese: どんなにやりたがっても、やらせるわけにはいかん。
english: No matter how much you want to do that, I can't let you.

japanese: ホテルは、冬季は休業します。
english: The hotel is closed throughout winter.

japanese: 冬の間は、ホテルは休館します。
english: The hotel is closed throughout winter.

japanese: もう、我慢できるかわかんないよ。
english: I don't know if I can take it anymore.

japanese: 子どもはお絵描きが好きです。
english: Kids like drawing.

japanese: 私の朝は、コーヒーで始まります。
english: I start every morning with a coffee.

japanese: トムはボストン生活が嫌でたまらなかった。
english: Tom hated living in Boston.

japanese: トムの論文は、非の打ち所がない。
english: Tom's treatise is beyond reproach.

japanese: トムは銃を手に入れた。
english: Tom got a firearm.

japanese: 幸運か厄災か？
english: Good luck or disaster?

japanese: 今日、あいつ落ち込んでるんだ。
english: He is feeling blue today.

japanese: 寝ちゃいそうだった。
english: I was almost asleep.

japanese: 眠りかけてた。
english: I was almost asleep.

japanese: 台所って、お手伝いがいる？
english: Do you need help in the kitchen?

japanese: 厨房って、人が足りてる？
english: Are there sufficient people in the kitchen?

japanese: コーヒーにプラスチックの破片が入ってるんですけど！
english: There's a little piece of plastic in my coffee!

japanese: そのスーツケース重い？
english: Are your suitcases heavy?

japanese: これはトムに教えてもらったんだよ。
english: I learned this from Tom.

japanese: 感謝の気持ちを伝えました。
english: I expressed my thanks.

japanese: 縦列駐車が苦手なのよ。
english: I'm not good at parallel parking.

japanese: まあ、いつかやってみるよ。
english: Maybe I'll try doing that one day.

japanese: 教科書に載ってるような表現で訳してみるのはどうだろう？
english: Why don't you try translating it like you'd see on a textbook?

japanese: 猫万歳！
english: Cats forever!

japanese: なんでもないから、気にしないで。
english: Nothing, don't worry about it.

japanese: 私には無理だってこと、ずっと分かってたのね。
english: You knew all along that I couldn't do that.

japanese: パンを食べると太るって、本当？
english: Is it true that eating bread will make you fat?

japanese: ずっと前から、僕には無理だって分かってたさ。
english: I've always known I can't do it.

japanese: トムは門を直そうとしました。
english: Tom tried to fix the gate.

japanese: どちらか一方に○印をお付けください。
english: Please add a circle to one or the other.

japanese: 車を見つけなきゃ。
english: We need to find a car.

japanese: アメリカ人はばかだ。
english: Americans are dumb.

japanese: 東京で、強い地震がありました。
english: There was a violent earthquake in Tokyo.

japanese: フランス語を学ぶのはあまり楽しくないと思う。
english: I think learning French isn't really fun.

japanese: ちょうど今、コンサートのリハーサルをしています。
english: Just right now, I'm doing a rehearsal for the concert.

japanese: チーズが大好物です。
english: Cheese is my favorite food.

japanese: サッカー界に新たなスターが彗星のごとく現れた。
english: A new star has appeared like a comet in the soccer world.

japanese: 人の好意を無下にしてばかりいると、いつか足をすくわれるよ。
english: If you always ignore people's goodwill, someday you're going to end up in a difficult situation.

japanese: 長時間労働を是とするような、旧態依然とした企業風土を打破しなければならない。
english: We must do away with the antiquated corporate culture that makes long working hours acceptable.

japanese: 文壇の大家ともあろう人が、まさか金銭トラブルを起こして晩節を汚すことになろうとは思いもよらなかった。
english: It was unheard of for a literary master, of all people, to get in financial trouble and fall in ruins.

japanese: トムに意地悪するのはやめなさいよ。
english: You need to stop being mean to Tom.

japanese: 愛国心の度合いは、人それぞれだ。
english: We each have different degrees of love for our country.

japanese: べろの横っちょが痛いんだ。
english: The side of my tongue hurts.

japanese: 舌の横側が痛いんです。
english: The side of my tongue hurts.

japanese: 救急車、来たよ。
english: The ambulance has arrived.

japanese: 救急車が到着しました。
english: The ambulance has arrived.

japanese: 着いたらすぐに電話しろよ。
english: Phone me as soon as you get there.

japanese: 私の人生、後悔だらけ。
english: My life is full of regret.

japanese: すぐに、止まって、倒れて、転がるんだ！
english: Quick, stop, drop, and roll!

japanese: 人生、結構満喫してるよね？
english: You're fully enjoying life, right?

japanese: トムは泣き止まなかった。
english: Tom didn't stop crying.

japanese: トムは泣き止みませんでした。
english: Tom didn't stop crying.

japanese: ホントかウソかを見抜くのは難しい。
english: It is hard to discern between true and false.

japanese: 夕飯は、ありあわせのもので間に合わせます。
english: Instead of going out shopping, I'll make dinner using food that we already have.

japanese: 晩ご飯は、買い物に行かず、あるもので作るよ。
english: Instead of going out shopping, I'll make dinner using food that we already have.

japanese: 雨が雪に変わりそうな天気です。
